result.execSummary:
The defendant Simone F Hart was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Barron County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Must contact the Department of Corrections today and report no later than close of business on Tuesday, July 12, 2022.

miscConds.notes: Must continue with current AODA and comply with recommended follow-up treatment.

Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent. Order for DNA given to defendant in court. Must report to the Barron County Jail immediately, to submit DNA sample.

Financial obligations are due within 60 days of the sentence date. The Barron County Clerk of Courts shall collect all financial obligations. In the event of non-payment of outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt. Attorney Fees To Be Determined.  Probation does NOT collect attorney fees.

timeConds.notes: Court grants 3 days credit if Probation is revoked.

9:45 AM Prosecuting attorney Brian H. Wright Aty in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Simone F Hart in court.  Attorney Michelle M Erdman in court for Simone F Hart.
Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights presented and discussed.  State recites agreement.  Guilty plea entered to Count 1.  Court finds plea is knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily given and finds the defendant guilty.  State and Defense waive PSI.  Court questions Defendant.  Court accepts waiver of PSI.  State relates.  Attorney Erdman relates.  Defendant relates.  Court relates and orders:

SW - 2 years Probation - Must contact Department of Corrections today and report no later than close of business on Tuesday, July 12, 2022.
Must maintain absolute sobriety.
Must continue with current AODA and comply with recommended follow-up treatment.
Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent.
Order for DNA given to defendant in court.  Must report to the Barron County Jail immediately to submit DNA sample.
Court costs - 60 DTP to Clerk of Court office.
3 days jail credit if Probation is revoked.

12:53 PM Defendant Simone F Hart appeared by video, in custody, Attorney Michelle M Erdman appeared by video for Simone F Hart, Attorney John Michael O'Boyle appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Erdman relates DE wishes to waive preliminary examination. Court performs colloquy and finds waiver is knowingly, voluntarily, and intelligently given, accepts waiver, and binds over. Parties to appear in person to next hearing.  Bond continues.
Arraignment scheduled for July 8, 2022 at 09:00 am.

10:03 AM Prosecuting attorney Julie L Matucheski appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Simone F Hart appeared by video, in custody, Attorney Michelle Erdman appeared by video for Simone F Hart. 

Set for preliminary hearing; may appear by zoom. (Attorney Erdman indicates the prelim will be a waiver)
Bond to continue.

(MS scanned to jail)
Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 7, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Office of State Public Defender Appointment of Counsel Report
Adjourned initial appearance on March 2, 2022 at 10:00 am.

2:13 PM Defendant Simone F Hart appeared by video, in custody. Attorney John Michael O'Boyle appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court relates on public defender report and counsel has not been appointed yet.  Court resets and must appear in person if not in custody.  Bond continues and must be fingerprinted on this case.

SCANNED TO BARRON COUNTY JAIL.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 2, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Office of State Public Defender Appointment of Counsel Report
Adjourned initial appearance on February 15, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant shall be fingerprinted at the Barron County Sheriff's Dept., if not already done.
If represented by the Public Defender and does not have a phone, must contact the Public Defender weekly at 715-908-8473.

01:05 PM Defendant Simone F Hart in court with attorney Andrew T Knaak for today.  Defendant Simone F Hart in custody.  Brian H. Wright appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Simone F Hart appeared by video means with Attorney.

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives further reading of same.
AIA set to insure defendant has counsel; may appear by zoom VIDEO or in person.
Defendant must call the public defenders office to determine eligibility.  If the defendant does not qualify for public defender representation, the defendant must complete a Petition for Appointment of an Attorney, Affidavit of Indigency also known as the blue form in order for the court to consider appointing an attorney.  Defendant may also hire her own attorney.

(Bond and MS scanned to jail)  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for February 15, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
